messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Santa claus
messages.msgSnippet: ... This has been facinating to me in Germany.  Santa comes in the person of St. Nikolaus on Dec. 6th.  He brings small toys and candy, and switches and coal.
messages.messageBody:
12/12/02 16:44:

> Very funny. But the engineer forgot to calculate in that not all Christian
> children believe in Santa. Spanish-the magi bring gifts on Ephiphany
> Sunday. Italian-An old woman (I forget her name) brings gifts.
> Some Christians-parents or the Christ Child brings gifts.

This has been facinating to me in Germany. Santa comes in the person of St.
Nikolaus on Dec. 6th. He brings small toys and candy, and switches and
coal. Children write their letters to the Kristkind (Christ Child), and the
Kristkind is the one who comes on Dec. 24. To me, that totally unwinds the
Santa/Jesus confusion of the holiday that happens in American culture.

(An interesting side note, totally unrelated to "proper" unschooling,
whatever the heck that is.)

brenda
